instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA: What is PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA? PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA is a 3.3 volt power rail that powers the camera. .
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Very clean board. No corrosion anywhere and only minor dust.

Green/amber light but no life. No response to SMC bypass. Checking the rails everything looks good down to <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> which is bouncing around from 3v-4.4v. <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_P5V</SIGNAL> is solid at 12.58v. Almost everything else on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is bouncing around.

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> - bouncing quickly from .8v-3v.. reball SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Not yet.
Did you try SMC bypass?
Is possible thet SMC detects an error and power cycles the board.

Check for short and voltage pulse on all secondary power rails (untill CPU VCORE).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - bouncing up to .1v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - .14v-.16v                      
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0v-.03v  --- 3ohms to ground :(
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - .8v-3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - .2v-.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - .1v-.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - .2v-.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - .1v-.2v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA</SIGNAL>  - .1v-.2v
 
Any suggestions where to start on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0v-.03v  --- 3ohms to ground"
Fix that.
You can try injecting voltage, no more than 6V.
Start with 2-3V and set amp limit at max on PSU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
It was <CAPACITOR>C6422</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>AUDIO_AMP_R</SIGNAL>. 
What causes that to short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
I saw this problem more on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> than <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards.
God bless we can get money so easy on Apple name.
